intro: Crossoglossa barfodii, commonly known as the Barfod's crossling, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive inflorescence. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a cross-shaped cluster, giving it its common name. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
